string.value: #b#@1022000:##k in #b#m102000000##k says he knows something about #rAndras#k. Let's talk to him.
Defeat #rAndras#k the demon!\n\nThere is a Demon's Doorway in #b#m102020300##k, and you can enter with Andras's emblem. Report back to #b#@1022000:##k in #bPerion#k after you defeat Andras.
You have defeated #rAndras#k whose seal has been released. But the mystery as to who released the seal still remains.

So, that evil Andras must have been responsible for the water shortage that created tension between #bKerning City#k and #bPerion#k.\nThe reason he attacked #b#p1012003##k was also to drive #bHenesys#k further away.

Long time, hmm...? You seem to have gotten stronger through all the adventures. Haha!
What?! Did you say #rAndras#k? How do you know that evil name?


(Tells him the entire story.)

Why did he do it, you ask? Why do you think he did it? He's downright evil!

He hasn't changed a bit.
#rAndras#k is a demon who was sealed in #bPerion#k. He is a vicious being, enjoying the pleasures of others' pain through combat. But who could have broken the seal of such an evil figure? Something is very fishy.

First things first, we must seal #rAndras#k before anything else.\nIf I remember correctly, there is a Demon's Doorway in #b#m102020300##k, where he was once sealed.\nHere, take this. This emblem will grant you access to the Demon's Doorway!
Now, go on and show me what you're made of! Defeat that evil #rAndras#k!\n\nFor your information, it may be wise to prepare ample potions ready for use.
There is no time to horse around. Hurry up and accept!
This novice Warrior here has really defeated Andras! How impressive!
It's great that #rAndras#k has been defeated, but we still haven't figured out who broke the seal.\nYou may encounter an even more powerful enemy in the near future, so keep training diligently.
